TITLE: Creating a Basic Svelte Component
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the structure of a Svelte component with script, markup, and style sections. The component includes a button that triggers an alert when clicked.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!file: App.svelte>
<script>
	function greet() {
		alert('Welcome to Svelte!');
	}
</script>

<button onclick={greet}>click me</button>

<style>
	button {
		font-size: 2em;
	}
</style>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using $state Rune for Reactive State
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create reactive state using the $state rune in Svelte 5. The example includes a button that increments a counter and updates the UI accordingly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	let count = $state(0);
</script>

<button onclick={() => count++}>
	clicks: {count}
</button>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Data Binding in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Data binding in Svelte allows data to flow upward from child to parent components. Supports various input types, group bindings, file inputs, and select elements with different binding patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<input bind:value={value} />
<input bind:value /> <!-- shorthand when names match -->
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<input bind:value={
	() => value,
	(v) => value = v.toLowerCase()}
/>

<!-- For readonly bindings -->
<div
	bind:clientWidth={null, redraw}
	bind:clientHeight={null, redraw}
>...</div>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!-- Text input -->
<script>
	let message = $state('hello');
</script>
<input bind:value={message} />

<!-- Numeric input coerces to number -->
<script>
	let a = $state(1);
	let b = $state(2);
</script>
<input type="number" bind:value={a} min="0" max="10" />
<input type="range" bind:value={b} min="0" max="10" />

<!-- Checkbox -->
<input type="checkbox" bind:checked={accepted} />

<!-- Form reset with defaultValue (v5.6.0+) -->
<form>
	<input bind:value defaultValue="not the empty string">
	<input type="reset" value="Reset">
</form>

<!-- Checkbox with defaultChecked (v5.6.0+) -->
<form>
	<input type="checkbox" bind:checked defaultChecked={true}>
	<input type="reset" value="Reset">
</form>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	let tortilla = $state('Plain');
	/** @type {Array<string>} */
	let fillings = $state([]);
</script>

<!-- Radio buttons -->
<input type="radio" bind:group={tortilla} value="Plain" />
<input type="radio" bind:group={tortilla} value="Whole wheat" />

<!-- Checkboxes -->
<input type="checkbox" bind:group={fillings} value="Rice" />
<input type="checkbox" bind:group={fillings} value="Beans" />
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	let files = $state();

	function clear() {
		files = new DataTransfer().files; // null/undefined won't work
	}
</script>

<input bind:files type="file" />
<button onclick={clear}>clear</button>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!-- Single select -->
<select bind:value={selected}>
	<option value={a}>a</option>
	<option value={b}>b</option>
</select>

<!-- Multiple select -->
<select multiple bind:value={fillings}>
	<option>Rice</option> <!-- value attribute can be omitted -->
	<option>Beans</option>
</select>

<!-- Default selection -->
<select bind:value={selected}>
	<option value={a}>a</option>
	<option value={b} selected>b</option>
</select>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up a New Svelte Project
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a new Svelte project using the command line. It includes steps for project initialization, dependency installation, and starting the development server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx sv create myapp
cd myapp
npm install
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Svelte Component Structure
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the different sections of a Svelte component file, including the script, module script, and style sections. Each section serves a specific purpose in component definition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
  // instance-level logic
  // use runes for reactivity
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script module>
  let total = 0;
  // Can export bindings (except default)
</script>

<script>
  total += 1;
  console.log(`instantiated ${total} times`);
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<style>
  p {
    /* only affects <p> in this component */
    color: burlywood;
  }
</style>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Reactive Class with $state
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use $state in class fields to create reactive properties. The example shows a Todo class with reactive done and text properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
class Todo {
	done = $state(false);
	text = $state();

	constructor(text) {
		this.text = text;
	}

	reset() {
		this.text = '';
		this.done = false;
	}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Typing Runes in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to type runes in Svelte 5, including $props, generic $props, and $state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_63

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts">
	import type { Snippet } from 'svelte';

	interface Props {
		requiredProperty: number;
		optionalProperty?: boolean;
		snippetWithStringArgument: Snippet<[string]>;
		eventHandler: (arg: string) => void;
		[key: string]: unknown;
	}

	let {
		requiredProperty,
		optionalProperty,
		snippetWithStringArgument,
		eventHandler,
		...everythingElse
	}: Props = $props();
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts" generics="Item extends { text: string }">
	interface Props {
		items: Item[];
		select(item: Item): void;
	}

	let { items, select }: Props = $props();
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// With initial value
let count: number = $state(0);

// Without initial value (use casting if needed)
let count = $state() as number;

// In classes
class Counter {
	count = $state() as number;
	constructor(initial: number) {
		this.count = initial;
	}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Using Writable Stores in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a writable store, subscribe to it, and update its value using the set and update methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_48

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	import { writable } from 'svelte/store';

	const count = writable(0);
	console.log($count); // logs 0

	count.set(1);
	console.log($count); // logs 1

	$count = 2;
	console.log($count); // logs 2
</script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using $effect Rune for Side Effects
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the $effect rune to perform side effects in response to state changes. The example updates a canvas based on size and color state changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	let size = $state(50);
	let color = $state('#ff3e00');
	let canvas;

	$effect(() => {
		const context = canvas.getContext('2d');
		context.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);

		// this will re-run whenever `color` or `size` change
		context.fillStyle = color;
		context.fillRect(0, 0, size, size);
	});
</script>

<canvas bind:this={canvas} width="100" height="100"></canvas>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Lifecycle Hooks in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the usage of onMount and onDestroy lifecycle hooks in Svelte 5 components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_52

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
  import { onMount } from 'svelte';

  onMount(() => {
    console.log('the component has mounted');
  });
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
  import { onDestroy } from 'svelte';

  onDestroy(() => {
    console.log('the component is being destroyed');
  });
</script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using $derived Rune for Computed Values
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to create derived values that update reactively based on their dependencies. The example shows a doubled value derived from a count state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	let count = $state(0);
	let doubled = $derived(count * 2);
</script>

<button onclick={() => count++}>
	{doubled}
</button>

<p>{count} doubled is {doubled}</p>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using State in Svelte 5 with Runes
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create and use state with Svelte 5's runes feature, which is preferred for most use cases over stores.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_49

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
/// file: state.svelte.js
export const userState = $state({
	name: 'name',
	/* ... */
});
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	import { userState } from './state.svelte.js';
</script>

<p>User name: {userState.name}</p>
<button onclick={() => {
	userState.name = 'new name';
}}>
	change name
</button>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Await Blocks in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Await blocks handle the three states of a Promise: pending, fulfilled, or rejected, with various simplified usage patterns for different scenarios.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#await promise}
	<p>waiting for the promise to resolve...</p>
{:then value}
	<p>The value is {value}</p>
{:catch error}
	<p>Something went wrong: {error.message}</p>
{/await}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#await promise}
	<p>waiting for the promise to resolve...</p>
{:then value}
	<p>The value is {value}</p>
{/await}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#await promise then value}
	<p>The value is {value}</p>
{/await}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#await promise catch error}
	<p>The error is {error}</p>
{/await}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#await import('./Component.svelte') then { default: Component }}
	<Component />
{/await}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Reactive State in Svelte.js Files
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use runes for reactive state in .svelte.js files. This example creates a counter with an increment function that can be shared across the app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// store.svelte.js
export let $state count = 0;
export const increment = () => count += 1;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining and Using Snippets in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Snippets create reusable markup chunks within components that can accept parameters and access the outer scope. They can be passed to other components explicitly or implicitly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#snippet name()}...{/snippet}
{#snippet name(param1, param2, paramN)}...{/snippet}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#snippet figure(image)}
	<figure>
		<img src={image.src} alt={image.caption} width={image.width} height={image.height} />
		<figcaption>{image.caption}</figcaption>
	</figure>
{/snippet}

{#each images as image}
	{#if image.href}
		<a href={image.href}>
			{@render figure(image)}
		</a>
	{:else}
		{@render figure(image)}
	{/if}
{/each}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	let { message = `it's great to see you!` } = $props();
</script>

{#snippet hello(name)}
	<p>hello {name}! {message}!</p>
{/snippet}

{@render hello('alice')}
{@render hello('bob')}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#snippet countdown(n)}
	{#if n > 0}
		<span>{n}...</span>
		{@render countdown(n - 1)}
	{:else}
		{@render blastoff()}
	{/if}
{/snippet}

{#snippet blastoff()}
	<span>ðŸš€</span>
{/snippet}

{@render countdown(10)}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	import Table from './Table.svelte';

	const fruits = [
		{ name: 'apples', qty: 5, price: 2 },
		{ name: 'bananas', qty: 10, price: 1 },
		{ name: 'cherries', qty: 20, price: 0.5 }
	];
</script>

{#snippet header()}
	<th>fruit</th>
	<th>qty</th>
	<th>price</th>
	<th>total</th>
{/snippet}

{#snippet row(d)}
	<td>{d.name}</td>
	<td>{d.qty}</td>
	<td>{d.price}</td>
	<td>{d.qty * d.price}</td>
{/snippet}

<Table data={fruits} {header} {row} />
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<Table data={fruits}>
	{#snippet header()}
		<th>fruit</th>
		<th>qty</th>
		<th>price</th>
		<th>total</th>
	{/snippet}

	{#snippet row(d)}
		<td>{d.name}</td>
		<td>{d.qty}</td>
		<td>{d.price}</td>
		<td>{d.qty * d.price}</td>
	{/snippet}
</Table>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!-- App.svelte -->
<Button>click me</Button>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!-- Button.svelte -->
<script>
	let { children } = $props();
</script>

<button>{@render children()}</button>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
    let { children } = $props();
</script>

{@render children?.()}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
    let { children } = $props();
</script>

{#if children}
    {@render children()}
{:else}
    fallback content
{/if}
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts">
	import type { Snippet } from 'svelte';

	interface Props {
		data: any[];
		children: Snippet;
		row: Snippet<[any]>;
	}

	let { data, children, row }: Props = $props();
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts" generics="T">
	import type { Snippet } from 'svelte';

	let {
		data,
		children,
		row
	}: {
		data: T[];
		children: Snippet;
		row: Snippet<[T]>;
	} = $props();
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script module>
	export { add };
</script>

{#snippet add(a, b)}
	{a} + {b} = {a + b}
{/snippet}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Readable Stores in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a readable store with a start function that updates the store value periodically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_50

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { readable } from 'svelte/store';

const time = readable(new Date(), (set) => {
	set(new Date());

	const interval = setInterval(() => {
		set(new Date());
	}, 1000);

	return () => clearInterval(interval);
});

const ticktock = readable('tick', (set, update) => {
	const interval = setInterval(() => {
		update((sound) => (sound === 'tick' ? 'tock' : 'tick'));
	}, 1000);

	return () => clearInterval(interval);
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Wrapper Components in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create wrapper components in Svelte 5 with TypeScript, including handling of HTML attributes and custom elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_65

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts">
	import type { HTMLButtonAttributes } from 'svelte/elements';

	let { children, ...rest }: HTMLButtonAttributes = $props();
</script>

<button {...rest}>
	{@render children?.()}
</button>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts">
	import type { SvelteHTMLElements } from 'svelte/elements';

	let { children, ...rest }: SvelteHTMLElements['div'] = $props();
</script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic TypeScript Usage in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates basic TypeScript usage in Svelte 5 components, including type annotations and event handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_61

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts">
	let name: string = 'world';

	function greet(name: string) {
		alert(`Hello, ${name}!`);
	}
</script>

<button onclick={(e: Event) => greet(e.target.innerText)}>
	{name as string}
</button>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Component Types in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Explains how to use component types in Svelte 5, including the Component type, ComponentProps, and component instances.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_64

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts">
	import type { Component } from 'svelte';

	interface Props {
		DynamicComponent: Component<{ prop: string }>;
	}

	let { DynamicComponent }: Props = $props();
</script>

<DynamicComponent prop="foo" />
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import type { Component, ComponentProps } from 'svelte';
import MyComponent from './MyComponent.svelte';

function withProps<TComponent extends Component<any>>(
	component: TComponent,
	props: ComponentProps<TComponent>
) {}

withProps(MyComponent, { foo: 'bar' });
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script lang="ts">
	import MyComponent from './MyComponent.svelte';

	let componentConstructor: typeof MyComponent = MyComponent;
	let componentInstance: MyComponent;
</script>

<MyComponent bind:this={componentInstance} />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Custom CSS-based Transitions in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a custom transition function that uses CSS for animation. The example preserves existing transforms while adding a scale effect.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	import { elasticOut } from 'svelte/easing';

	export let visible;

	function whoosh(node, params) {
		const existingTransform = getComputedStyle(node).transform.replace('none', '');

		return {
			delay: params.delay || 0,
			duration: params.duration || 400,
			easing: params.easing || elasticOut,
			css: (t, u) => `transform: ${existingTransform} scale(${t})`
		};
	}
</script>

{#if visible}
	<div in:whoosh>whooshes in</div>
{/if}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Context in Svelte Components
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set and get context in Svelte components, allowing parent components to pass data to child components without prop drilling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_51

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!-- Parent.svelte -->
<script>
	import { setContext } from 'svelte';

	setContext('my-context', 'hello from Parent.svelte');
</script>
```

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!-- Child.svelte -->
<script>
	import { getContext } from 'svelte';

	const message = getContext('my-context');
</script>

<h1>{message}, inside Child.svelte</h1>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Component Property Bindings in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Examples of creating bindable properties in components and using them in parent components. Shows how to create bindable props with optional default values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<!-- Parent -->
<Keypad bind:value={pin} />

<!-- Child (Keypad.svelte) -->
<script>
	let { value = $bindable() } = $props();
</script>

<!-- With fallback -->
<script>
	let { bindableProperty = $bindable('fallback value') } = $props();
</script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using bind:this with Elements and Components in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to bind directly to DOM elements or component instances using bind:this. This allows direct access to elements for canvas manipulation or component method calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	/** @type {HTMLCanvasElement} */
	let canvas;

	$effect(() => {
		const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
		drawStuff(ctx);
	});
</script>

<canvas bind:this={canvas}></canvas>

<!-- Component instances -->
<ShoppingCart bind:this={cart} />
<button onclick={() => cart.empty()}>Empty cart</button>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Scoped Styles in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates Svelte's automatic style scoping within components using generated classes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_46

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<style>
	p {
		/* this will only affect <p> elements in this component */
		color: burlywood;
	}
</style>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the Imperative Component API in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the mount, unmount, and hydrate functions from Svelte's imperative component API for dynamic component handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_53

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { mount } from 'svelte';
import App from './App.svelte';

const app = mount(App, {
  target: document.querySelector('#app'),
  props: { some: 'property' }
});
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { mount, unmount } from 'svelte';
import App from './App.svelte';

const app = mount(App, { target: document.body });

// later
unmount(app, { outro: true });
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { hydrate } from 'svelte';
import App from './App.svelte';

const app = hydrate(App, {
  target: document.querySelector('#app'),
  props: { some: 'property' }
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using @const Tag in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: The @const tag defines a local constant within a block, allowing for derived calculations that are only executed once per iteration or condition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
{#each boxes as box}
	{@const area = box.width * box.height}
	{box.width} * {box.height} = {area}
{/each}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dynamic Styles with style: directive in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to bind dynamic values to CSS properties using the style: directive. This allows reactive styling based on component state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<div style:color={myColor}>...</div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: TypeScript Setup in Svelte 5 with SvelteKit/Vite
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set up TypeScript in a Svelte 5 project using SvelteKit/Vite, including configuration for non-type-only features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_62

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// svelte.config.js
import { vitePreprocess } from '@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte';

const config = {
	preprocess: vitePreprocess()
};

export default config;
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// svelte.config.js
import { vitePreprocess } from '@sveltejs/vite-plugin-svelte';

const config = {
	preprocess: vitePreprocess({ script: true })
};

export default config;
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2022", // or "ES2015" with "useDefineForClassFields": true
    "verbatimModuleSyntax": true,
    "isolatedModules": true
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Actions with use: Directive in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create and use actions with the use: directive. Actions allow running code when an element is mounted and handling cleanup when unmounted.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	/** @type {import('svelte/action').Action} */
	function myaction(node) {
		$effect(() => {
			// setup code
			return () => {
				// cleanup code
			};
		});
	}
</script>

<div use:myaction>...</div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Typed Actions with Custom Events in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a typed action with custom events in Svelte. Shows how to dispatch custom events from an action and properly type them with TypeScript.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	/**
	 * @type {import('svelte/action').Action<
	 * 	HTMLDivElement,
	 * 	undefined,
	 * 	{
	 * 		onswiperight: (e: CustomEvent) => void;
	 * 		onswipeleft: (e: CustomEvent) => void;
	 * 	}
	 * >}
	 */
	function gestures(node) {
		$effect(() => {
			// ...
			node.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('swipeleft'));
			// ...
			node.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('swiperight'));
		});
	}
</script>

<div
	use:gestures
	onswipeleft={next}
	onswiperight={prev}
>...</div>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Transitions in Svelte
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using transitions with the transition: directive in Svelte. Shows how elements can animate when entering or leaving the DOM based on state changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: svelte
CODE:
```
<script>
	import { fade } from 'svelte/transition';
	let visible = $state(false);
</script>

<button onclick={() => visible = !visible}>toggle</button>

{#if visible}
	<div transition:fade>fades in and out</div>
{/if}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extending DOM Types in Svelte 5
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to extend DOM types in Svelte 5 for custom elements and attributes, providing two alternative approaches.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kspr9/svelte5forllms/blob/main/svelte-distilled.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_66

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// additional-svelte-typings.d.ts
declare namespace svelteHTML {
	interface IntrinsicElements {
		'my-custom-element': { someattribute: string; 'on:event': (e: CustomEvent<any>) => void };
	}
	interface HTMLAttributes<T> {
		onbeforeinstallprompt?: (event: any) => any;
		mycustomattribute?: any;
	}
}
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// additional-svelte-typings.d.ts
import { HTMLButtonAttributes } from 'svelte/elements';

declare module 'svelte/elements' {
	export interface SvelteHTMLElements {
		'custom-button': HTMLButtonAttributes;
	}

	export interface HTMLButtonAttributes {
		veryexperimentalattribute?: string;
	}
}

export {};
```
